confession.seduction_context: Was in service with Jean Demenge Claude of Blesmerey, guarding horses when approached by man in black
sabbat_activities: carried by master through air to assembly

witnesses.name: Jean Henry
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor of Grand Demenge Charpentier who quarreled with accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Horses straying into Noel's meadow, followed by fight between Noel and Grand Demenge Charpentier
testimony.threat_quote: que puis qu'il avoit mangé son pres sciemment qu'il luy garderoit quelque bon plaisir et qu'il s'en donroit bien de garde

harms_alleged.target: small son of Grand Waultrin Charpentier
harms_alleged.target_relationship: son of Grand Waultrin, nephew of Grand Demenge

testimony.quarrel_subject: Noel and others from Blemerey stole hens in Gondrexon and were told off by local women including witness's wife
Her son Mathieu refused to help Noel with his cart during hay harvest
Noel upbraided husband Vallentin for leaving animals unattended for allegedly 3 hours (actually 1 hour)
testimony.threat_quote: l'on luy tenoit le menton bien gras, mais avant qu'il fut le Noel suyvant qu'il ne seroit empesché de se garder et qu'il pourroit bien parachever son terme frappant cependant les mains l'une dedans l'aultre et estant en grand colere

testimony.quarrel_subject: Brother's refusal to cart hay for Noel

witnesses.name: Claudon Jean Claudon
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: nearest neighbor, victim of alleged witchcraft

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute over payment of costs after Noel's imprisonment at Blamont 8-9 years earlier; witness called Noel a witch
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il y en avoit de ceulx qui avoient mangé de son bien et rouillé des os, quy s'en resentiroient et s'en donneroient de garde

testimony.quarrel_subject: Witness agreed to plough Noel's field twice, but after first ploughing, refused to do second ploughing due to unexpected demand from brother

timeline.subject: Witnesses 10-17
timeline.details: Additional witnesses from Reillon, Gondrexon, and Leintrey

timeline.subject: Noel Purel
timeline.details: Denied all charges, claimed Jean de Colbay had withdrawn accusation

timeline.subject: Noel Purel with witnesses
timeline.details: Accepted witnesses as worthy but denied their interpretation; accused Claudon Jean Claudon of felling tree in communal woods

timeline.subject: Noel Purel
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approved torture, but moderately given his age

timeline.subject: Noel Purel
timeline.details: First session: thumbscrews and rack, withstood; second session after dinner with tourtillons, finally confessed to being witch for 40 years; recognized as mentally confused by end

timeline.subject: Noel Purel
timeline.details: Provided detailed confessions about harming animals and people, attending sabbat, making hail; racked again to name accomplices

timeline.subject: Noel Purel
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approved death sentence

timeline.subject: Noel Purel
timeline.details: Death sentence; goods worth 1,545 Fr, widow allowed to keep them for 1,000 Fr payable in two installments

torture.restrictions: assez mediocrement eu esgard a l'age dudit prevenu (moderately given his age)

accomplices_named.name: la Jobarde
accomplices_named.context: Only person Noel recognized at sabbat

prior_accusations.context: Accused Noel at his execution 30-34 years before trial (circa 1568-1572); multiple witnesses present at execution

notable_quotes.speaker: Noel Purel to Grand Demenge Charpentier
notable_quotes.french: que puis qu'il avoit mangé son pres sciemment qu'il luy garderoit quelque bon plaisir et qu'il s'en donroit bien de garde
notable_quotes.english: since he had knowingly eaten his meadow, he would keep some good pleasure for him and that he should beware
notable_quotes.context: Threat after quarrel over horses straying into meadow

notable_quotes.speaker: Grand Demenge Charpentier to Noel Purel
notable_quotes.french: qu'il n'estoit guiere bon, qu'il le scavoit bien, et que s'il luy survenoit quelque scandale qu'il le feroit brusler
notable_quotes.english: that he was not very good, that he knew it well, and that if any scandal befell him he would have him burned
notable_quotes.context: Response to Noel's threat, invoking his bad reputation

notable_quotes.speaker: Noel Purel to Vallentin Mesline
notable_quotes.french: l'on luy tenoit le menton bien gras, mais avant qu'il fut le Noel suyvant qu'il ne seroit empesché de se garder et qu'il pourroit bien parachever son terme frappant cependant les mains l'une dedans l'aultre et estant en grand colere
notable_quotes.english: his chin was held nice and fat, but before the next Christmas he would not be prevented from taking care of himself and that he could well finish his term, striking his hands together while in great anger
notable_quotes.context: Threat to shepherd during quarrel over allegedly leaving animals unattended

notable_quotes.speaker: Vallentin Mesline to Noel Purel
notable_quotes.context: Insult during quarrel; Noel later confessed using powder against Didier Cherier who also called him 'genot'

notable_quotes.speaker: Noel Purel to witness's sister about Jean Renard
notable_quotes.french: ton frere a bien esté estrillé
notable_quotes.english: your brother has been well thrashed/beaten
notable_quotes.context: Comment about hailstorm damage at la Chazelle

notable_quotes.speaker: Noel Purel after son refused to help
notable_quotes.context: Said when leaving after Mathieu refused to help cart hay

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Jean Claudon to Noel Purel
notable_quotes.context: Called him witch during dispute over payment of costs

notable_quotes.speaker: Noel Purel to Claudon Jean Claudon
notable_quotes.french: qu'il y en avoit de ceulx qui avoient mangé de son bien et rouillé des os, quy s'en resentiroient et s'en donneroient de garde
notable_quotes.english: that there were those who had eaten his goods and gnawed bones, who would feel it and beware

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Mongeotte and community of Gondrexon
notable_quotes.french: ont tousjours . . . heu oppinion que tous les malheurs et desastres que leurs ont arrivés, notamment en leurs grains par gresle, provenoient par les moyens et sortileges dudit Noel
notable_quotes.english: always had the opinion that all the misfortunes and disasters that befell them, notably their grains by hail, came by the means and sorcery of said Noel
notable_quotes.context: Community belief about cause of hailstorms

relationships.evidence_text: Had then been in service with Jean Demenge Claude of Blesmerey
Grand Demenge was helped by his brother Grand Waultrin
who was accompanied by small son
told off severely by local women, including his wife
he left children in charge of animals
respect in which Claudon's uncle was held
his sister, who was in service with Noel
who was in service with Noel at the time

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over agricultural labor and costs. Dispute with Claudon Jean Claudon over payment of costs after Noel's imprisonment at Blamont. Quarrels over meadow damage by horses, refusal to help cart hay, refusal to complete ploughing agreement. Noel accused Claudon Jean Claudon of illegally felling tree in communal woods. Goods worth 1,545 Fr at time of execution.

harms_catalog.victim_name: small son of Grand Waultrin Charpentier
harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: nephew of neighbor Grand Demenge, son of his brother Grand Waultrin
harms_catalog.harm_description: bad leg, never recovered properly despite much expenditure on surgeons and remedies
harms_catalog.economic_value: much expenditure on surgeons and remedies
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Horses straying into Noel's meadow, quarrel and fight between Noel and Grand Demenge Charpentier

harms_catalog.victim_name: 2 pigs and a dog belonging to Claudon de Benamesnil
harms_catalog.harm_description: death of 2 pigs and a dog
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Noel and others from Blemerey stole hens in Gondrexon and were scolded by local women

harms_catalog.harm_description: heavy and frequent losses through hailstorms
troubled in his mind, mental illness
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mathieu refused to help Noel cart hay during harvest

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, vomiting continuously, had to give up work, died miserably
harms_catalog.economic_value: had to give up work as paistre
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Noel upbraided Vallentin for leaving animals unattended, claiming 3 hours absence when only 1 hour

harms_catalog.victim_name: 2 horses belonging to Claudon Jean Claudon
harms_catalog.harm_description: 2 horses ill for many weeks, one died and other had to be killed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute over payment of costs after Noel's imprisonment at Blamont; witness called Noel witch

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, debilitée et seiche (weakened and dried out), bedridden for last 5 months, surgeons could do nothing, died after a year

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness agreed to plough Noel's field twice but refused second ploughing due to demand from brother

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed by scattering powder because hay harvest was poor; included some of Noel's own animals and two of Claudon Jean Claudon
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: poor hay harvest, frequent disputes with Claudon Jean Claudon

harms_catalog.harm_description: hail on vines ordered by master after exceptional wine harvest
harms_catalog.attributed_to: other witches (Noel was unwilling as he had vines)

religious_calendar_references: Christmas (Noel) - 'avant qu'il fut le Noel suyvant'

prior_legal_disputes.description: Previously imprisoned at Blamont 8-9 years before trial; dispute over payment of costs with Claudon Jean Claudon after release
Noel accused Claudon Jean Claudon of felling tree in communal woods illegally
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Case didn't go to justice because of respect for Claudon's uncle

legal_context.redress_outcome: Noel claimed Jean de Colbay withdrew his accusation; had attestation from late governor of Blamont which was lost, having been produced when last imprisoned
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Imprisoned at Blamont previously; imprisoned during this trial before torture and execution

hearsay_chains.source: present at execution of Jean Colbay
hearsay_chains.content: Jean Colbay accused Noel of being witch

hearsay_chains.source: present at execution of Jean Colbay
hearsay_chains.content: heard Colbay's case read out accusing Noel

hearsay_chains.source: his sister who was in service with Noel
hearsay_chains.content: Noel's comment about brother being 'estrillé' by hailstorm

hearsay_chains.source: present at execution of Jean Colbay

hearsay_chains.content: brother Mathieu's illness after refusing to help Noel

emotional_state_notes: At end of torture recognized as 'perplexe en son entendement' (confused in his understanding)

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Accused Claudon Jean Claudon of illegally felling tree in communal woods, though couldn't say who told him; suggested case didn't go to justice because of respect for Claudon's uncle

third_parties.name: Jean de Colbay (also Jean Colbay)
third_parties.context: Executed as witch 30-34 years before trial at château de Lannoy; accused Noel publicly; Noel claimed he later withdrew accusation

third_parties.name: Grand Demenge Charpentier
third_parties.context: Quarreled with Noel over horses in meadow; his brother's son fell ill after quarrel

third_parties.name: Grand Waultrin Charpentier
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: brother of Grand Demenge who quarreled with Noel
third_parties.context: Brother of Grand Demenge; his small son developed bad leg after quarrel

third_parties.name: Pierson Florentin
third_parties.context: Man from Amenoncourt who married girl from Blemerey; wedding feast where Noel and others stole hens

third_parties.name: Claude Petit Claude
third_parties.context: Went with Jean Mongeotte to seek threshers at Herbeviller

third_parties.name: Mathieu
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: son of Anne veuve Demenge Claude (witness 7), brother of Jean Demenge Claude (witness 9)
third_parties.context: Youngest son who refused to help cart hay; became 'troublé' (mentally ill) within a week but continued playing cards

third_parties.name: Vallentin Mesline
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: quarreled with Noel over animals; called him 'petit genot'
third_parties.context: Paistre (shepherd) who worked at Blemerey, Reillon, and Gondrexon; became ill after Noel touched his shoulder; died miserably

third_parties.name: Didier Cherier
third_parties.context: In confession, Noel admitted using powder to kill Didier's cow as first use of devil's powder

third_parties.name: late governor of Blamont
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: provided attestation that Jean de Colbay withdrew accusation
third_parties.context: Official who gave Noel document showing Colbay withdrew accusation; document lost

third_parties.name: sister of Jean Renard
third_parties.context: Servant of Noel who reported his comment about hailstorm damage to her brother

third_parties.name: wife of Claudon Jean Claudon
third_parties.context: Became ill, weakened and dried out; bedridden 5 months; died after a year; surgeons could do nothing

third_parties.name: uncle of Claudon Jean Claudon
third_parties.context: Held in such respect that case against Claudon for felling tree didn't go to justice

third_parties.name: brother of Claudon Clerc
third_parties.context: Made unexpected demand on Claudon, causing him to refuse second ploughing for Noel

third_parties.name: Jean Demenge Claude of Blesmerey
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: former employer - Noel was in his service 40 years before
third_parties.context: Noel was in service with him guarding horses when devil first approached him

third_parties.name: Pairsin (also Mre Persin)
third_parties.context: Appeared as man in black; gave Noel money (pieces of wood) and black powder; Noel decided he was 'abuseur' and didn't see him after early period

third_parties.name: widow of Noel Purel
third_parties.context: Allowed to keep goods worth 1,545 Fr for payment of 1,000 Fr in two installments

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with 17 witnesses, extensive torture session, full confession, and clear timeline. Noel's reputation spanned 30-36 years with prior accusation from executed witch Jean de Colbay. Key themes: agricultural disputes, hailstorm accusations affecting multiple communities, quarrels over labor and costs, touch and powder as methods. Noel initially withstood torture but eventually confessed after prolonged session including thumbscrews, rack, and tourtillons. Recognized as mentally confused by end of torture. Named 4 accomplices. Executed with property confiscation but widow allowed to retain goods for payment.
